Package com.tinocs.mp.greenfoot

Class LocalImage

  • java.lang.Object
    • greenfoot.GreenfootImage
      • com.tinocs.mp.greenfoot.LocalImage
  • public class LocalImage
extends greenfoot.GreenfootImage
    A LocalImage is used as the image of a LocalActor. A LocalImage saves a reference to the actor they belong to and whenever the image changes, it broadcasts the change to the other clients so they can update the images of the corresponding actors in their worlds to reflect changes.
    Version:
    5/8/2023
    Author:
    Ted McLeod

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      LocalImage​(greenfoot.GreenfootImage image, LocalActor actor)
      Create a LocalImage that is a copy of the given image and belongs to the given actor.
      LocalImage​(java.lang.String fileName, LocalActor actor)
      Create a LocalImage loaded from the file with the given fileName that belongs to the given actor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LocalImage

        public LocalImage​(greenfoot.GreenfootImage image,
                  LocalActor actor)
        Create a LocalImage that is a copy of the given image and belongs to the given actor.
        Parameters:
        image - the image to copy
        actor - the LocalActor this image belongs to

      • LocalImage

        public LocalImage​(java.lang.String fileName,
                  LocalActor actor)
        Create a LocalImage loaded from the file with the given fileName that belongs to the given actor. The file with the given fileName should be located in the images folder of the scenario.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the image file
        actor - the LocalActor this image belongs to

    • Method Detail

        Parameters:

      • broadcast

        public void broadcast​(java.lang.String message)
        Broadcast the given message to the other clients. If the actor is null or is not in an MPWorld with a connected client, then nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to broadcast.

      • setTransparency

        public void setTransparency​(int t)
        Set the transparency of the image and broadcast the change to the other clients.
        Overrides:
        setTransparency in class greenfoot.GreenfootImage
        Parameters:
        t - A value in the range 0 to 255. 0 is completely transparent (invisible) and 255 is completely opaque (the default).

      • mirrorHorizontally

        public void mirrorHorizontally()
        Mirror this image horizontally and broadcast the change to the other clients.
